meta.title: Pitch
meta.description: Nostr Web of Trust — Spam-free decentralized networks. No central authority. No gatekeepers.

slide0.label: nostr-wot.com
slide0.subtitle:
Spam-free decentralized networks.
No central authority. No gatekeepers.

slide1.label: Background
slide1.description: <mb>MappingBitcoin</mb> maps 24,000+ venues worldwide. But without reviews and ratings, it's just a directory — trust is missing. Nobody in the Bitcoin space is solving this.

slide16.label: Background
slide16.description: Nostr is Bitcoin-native by design. We built reviews, ratings, and venue verification on top of it — using email & domain ownership as proof. A real trust layer for real places.

slide2.label: Problem #1
slide2.description: Nostr is the natural protocol for Bitcoin-native reviews. But it's permissionless by design — open reviews with no sybil resistance get flooded with fake data immediately.

slide3.label: Problem #2
slide3.description: Web of Trust exists as a concept. Existing tools require deep cryptographic knowledge, self-hosted infrastructure, and custom integration. No final user can use it. No product has made it accessible.

slide4.label: Problem #3
slide4.description: Most Nostr clients compute Web of Trust in isolation — each one rebuilding the social graph from scratch. No shared infrastructure. Slow computation. Constant reliance on third-party services. The result? A decentralized protocol with centralized trust layers.

slide5.label: Problem #4
slide5.description: Extensions are confusing. Onboarding is painful. Everything feels too technical, too convoluted. Clients crash, break, or just don't work. Normal people can't use any of this.

slide6.label: Problem #4
slide6.description: Yeah, we put this twice. It's not a bug, it's a joke.

slide7.label: Solution #1
slide7.description: Rust-based engine calculating social graph distance across the Nostr network in sub-millisecond time. Any application can query trust scores via a simple API — no setup required.
slide7.feat3: Open API — any app, any protocol

slide8.label: Solution #2
slide8.description: Drop-in SDK that lets any Nostr application integrate Web of Trust in minutes. Filter content, verify identities, weight reviews by trust distance. No infrastructure to run.
slide8.feat3: Works on any Nostr client or webapp

slide9.label: Solution #3
slide9.description: A Chrome extension that works like uBlock for the decentralized web. Users see only content from their Web of Trust. Spam disappears. No central moderation — just your social graph deciding what's relevant.
slide9.feat1: Install once — works across all Nostr apps
slide9.feat3: Extensible to the entire crypto ecosystem

slide10.label: Live Demo
slide10.description: Query your Web of Trust. Filter noise. See social graph distance become a spam-proof content layer.

slide11.label: Identity Module
slide11.description: A complete identity layer for Nostr — simple enough for anyone, powerful enough for power users.
slide11.feat3: Easy onboarding — no crypto knowledge needed
slide11.feat4: Prompt per kind — granular permission control

slide12.label: WoT Module
slide12.description: Your trust graph, your rules. Full control over how you filter the decentralized web.
slide12.feat4: Local sync, remote, or hybrid mode

slide14.label: Documentation
slide14.description: Guides, references, and integration docs for every component. From getting started to advanced configurations — everything you need to build on Web of Trust.

slide15.label: NIPs & Standards
slide15.description: We're not just building products — we're proposing NIPs to make Web of Trust a first-class citizen across the entire Nostr ecosystem.
slide15.feat3: Open collaboration with the Nostr community

slide17.label: The Ask
slide17.description: We're building in the open and looking for partners who believe in decentralized trust.
slide17.feat5: Diffusion — spread the word, share the vision
